It might be the universal extractor - as I recall it's quite CPU 
consuming? - correct me Stack or Gordon if I'm wrong

My crawls are running at around the same speed with yesterdays build.

best
Bjarne Andersen

Matt Ittigson wrote:
> Some change in the code between earlier today and May 31st has caused
> a massive slowdown in the speed which I'm downloading data.  On the
> same machine, configured in the same way, a version of Heritrix I
> built from CVS, from earlier today, could not muster more than 30K/s
> on the same seed file that the May 31st version is currently doing
> 728K/s.
> 
> Perhaps the difference is in configuration?  Maybe I'm enabling a
> newer configuration variable which is slowing things down?  The
> difference between the order.xml files are only additions in the newer
> version:
> 
> reread-seeds-on-config: true
> use-bdb-for-cookies: true
> the universal extractor (with default configuration)
> LinkScoper instead of Postselector (with default configuration)
> 
> Would any of the log files be of use to track down the problem?
> 
> Thanks.
> 
> -matt
>
